place.name: AWSWORTH
place.gazetteerText: AWSWORTH, a chapelry in Nuthall parish, Notts; 3½ miles W of Bulwell r. station, and 6 NW of Nottingham. Post Town, Bulwell under Nottingham. Rated property, £900. Pop., 294. The property is subdivided. Most of the inhabitants are colliers or stocking weavers. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £101.* Patron, the rector of Nuthall. The church is modern. There is a P. Methodist chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
